title.narrative: AWARENESS OF CHILDREN AS RIGHTS HOLDERS

description.narrative: Children, adults and professionals in related sectors have an enhanced awareness and understanding of children as rights holders and of mechanisms for realizing their rights, with special focus on boys and girls belonging to minority groups and boys and girls with disabilities, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys progressively utilise well governed and accountable child rights coordination and monitoring systems and have equitable access to justice, by 2022.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children, adults and professionals in related sectors have an enhanced awareness and understanding of children as rights holdersand of mechanisms for realizing their rights, with special focus on boys and girls belonging to minority groups and boys and girlswith disabilities

description.narrative: Working with CSOs and the Ombudsperson’s Department for Child Rights and their outreach activities, children from the most vulnerable groups- children with disabilities, Roma children, children in institutions were reached and enabled to increase their awareness and knowledge on children’s rights and on how to seek redress when the rights are violated. This led to led to an increase in the number of children who came forward to report rights violations, or to ask questions and seek advice. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022

title.narrative: Availability of child friendly website and promotional materials, including in the language/form understandable to children belonging to minority groups and children with disabilities(46502), Text

baseline.value: Child friendly website not set up

target.value: 2021:Child friendly website set up, including in language/form understandable to children belonging to minority groups and children with disabilities

actual.value: 2021:Various child friendly material for chidlren and parents developed by national institutions and CSOs which content is available into minority languages and Braille language.

title.narrative: Information on child rights in a child-friendly format is available to children and their families(62707)

baseline.value: Limited information on child rights and where to seek support

target.value: 2021:Information on child rights and where to seek support including for children from minority groups and children with disabilities available and widely disseminated

actual.value: 2021:Information on child rights and where to seek support including for children from minority groups and children with disabilities available and widely disseminated
